image.altText: A sign that says Campbell Primary School.

props.synopsis: The ACT has closed 15 public schools today, with several others partially closed due to potential asbestos contamination.

title.children: List of Canberra schools closed after decorative coloured sand recall

image.altText: Pink sand in a dish with a spoon.

props.synopsis: Schools in Canberra and Brisbane are closed today due to asbestos in decorative coloured sand.

title.children: ACT, Qld schools closed over asbestos risk in coloured sand

image.altText: Four types of coloured sand products have been recalled.

props.synopsis: Fifteen public schools in Canberra are closed today and several others are partially closed due to potential asbestos contamination in coloured sand sold at dozens of stores across Australia. Here's what we know.

title.children: What to do if you have the coloured sand product recalled for asbestos in your home

image.altText: A car on a police trailer with police officers standing nearby all next to a lake with police tape in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The 39-year-old will remain in custody after a judge rejected his request for bail to attend drug rehabilitation.

title.children: Man who leapt into lake to escape police chase denied bail

image.altText: sign saying yass valley council on a red brick building

props.synopsis: The Yass Valley Council defers a decision on whether to raise rates by at least 40 per cent as it looks to make savings in various areas.

title.children: Yass Valley Council considering raising rates by up to 58pc

image.altText: A man with short blonde hair stands speaking, with a woman with long blonde hair standing behind him.

props.synopsis: To be the leader of the Canberra Liberals you need to be thick-skinned, have a lot of persistence, and be very confident — and if Mark Parton's first press conference in the role is anything to go by, he might just be the perfect fit.

title.children: Who is the ACT's new opposition leader that wants to 'leave shit behind'?

image.altText: Proposed site of Russian Embassy in Canberra

props.synopsis: The lease was granted to Russia in 2008, but was withdrawn when parliament passed a new law citing ASIO advice that the planned embassy could pose a threat to national security.

title.children: Russia loses High Court battle with Commonwealth over embassy site

image.altText: A building sign that reads 'ACT Civil and Administrative Tribunal'.

props.synopsis: An international student has been awarded $10,000 in compensation after a tribunal found she was unfairly evicted from her university accommodation after she made complaints about noisy students.

title.children: Student who complained about noise unfairly evicted from uni housing

image.altText: A possum-skin quilt built from squares etched with messages about the promise of the treaty process.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of treaties exist between First Nations people and governments around the world. One state in Australia just became one of them.

title.children: Victoria's treaty is here. What does it mean? And is one coming to my state?

image.altText: Storm clouds brewing over a rural highway

props.synopsis: Peak severe weather season is arriving, and an influx of tropical moisture will fuel thunderstorms in all Australian states and territories between Friday and Sunday.

title.children: Supercell risk as 72-hour storm outbreak to light up skies

image.altText: A building entrance with "BBC" written above it.

props.synopsis: The BBC tells the US president it is sorry for a Panorama episode that spliced parts of a speech he gave on January 6, 2021, but says it won't meet his demands for compensation.

title.children: BBC apologises to Trump, but rejects compensation demands

image.altText: A tall thin rocket takes off from launch pad, vertically, against a blue sky.

props.synopsis: Blue Origin has successfully launched the 98-metre New Glenn rocket with a pair of NASA spacecraft destined for Mars.

title.children: Blue Origin launches huge rocket carrying twin NASA spacecraft to Mars

image.altText: Two happy dogs, one large and one small, on a beach.

props.synopsis: The huge range of dog breeds that exists today is often thought of as a modern phenomenon, but new research suggests this vast diversity started thousands of years ago.

title.children: Once wolves became dogs they quickly diversified, study shows

image.altText: A young girl in a school uniform poses in front of a garden

props.synopsis: Parents of children at a Sydney school where a five-year-old girl was fatally struck are demanding action to improve road safety after it emerged two more children were hit by cars nearby before the girl's death.

title.children: Parents demand action as three children hit by cars near Sydney school

image.altText: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, Virginia Giuffre and Ghislaine Maxwell posing for a picture.

props.synopsis: The former prince has repeatedly denied ever meeting Ms Giuffre, including during an infamous interview with the BBC in 2019.

title.children: Epstein email says Andrew had photo taken with accuser Virginia Giuffre

image.altText: An unidentified child care worker holding hands with a child.

props.synopsis: Almost a decade after one was recommended by the Royal Commission into Institutional Responses to Child Sexual Abuse.

title.children: Working with children check tracker established amid pressure on child care

image.altText: An empty mail box.

props.synopsis: The average first-time home buyer in the US is older than ever, but a new proposal could leave them paying off a mortgage until old age.

title.children: Trump officials float 50-year 'gamechanger' mortgages. Others aren't sure

image.altText: A grain silo looms in front of a starry purple, pink and green sky

props.synopsis: Another week is behind us Can you recall the big news stories of the past seven days?

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Black Friday sales, a stunning aurora and a whole lot of bagpipes

image.altText: The family of a 49-year-old WA man, whose death was initially linked to the Optus Triple-Zero outage, say they have been kept in the dark by authorities.

props.synopsis: The family of a Perth man whose death was tied to the Optus Triple Zero outage claims authorities left them in the dark for weeks and are still unsure how his death was connected to the telco failure.

title.children: Family still waiting for answers on whether father's death linked to Optus outage

image.altText: A purple and green sky with the silhouettes of big trees

props.synopsis: The strength of the latest geomagnetic storms has seen the aurora australis light up skies across a larger part of the country than usual.

title.children: They're called the southern lights. But they dazzled Australians further north

image.altText: Eliesa Katoa of Tonga is attended to by a trainer, holding a towel, bleeding an with head injuries

props.synopsis: A leading concussion expert calls for sporting bodies to strengthen their protocols on players who are concussed before and during matches.

title.children: Neuroscientist calls for doctors at games following Katoa concussions

image.altText: GettyImages-2181573573

props.synopsis: Kyra Cooney-Cross is nominated for the goal of the year award, but has stiff competition from the player the award is named after.

title.children: Matildas star up for goal of the year award after long-range stunner

image.altText: Socceroos defender Milos Degenek runs out onto the pitch as he prepares to warm up for a match

props.synopsis: Socceroos defender Miloš Degenek wasn't sure if he'd ever make it back to the national side, now he's a key cog in the team, and entertaining the thought of a World Cup win.

title.children: Manifesting a World Cup victory is driving this Socceroo to glory

image.altText: Reflection of person holding umbrella below Nasdaq sign

props.synopsis: The ASX falls steeply in response to a sharp drop on Wall Street overnight, which was led by a big decline in tech stocks. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX drops sharply after Wall St tumbles

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Falls across the board as ASX drops more than 1.5%
ASX 200 and All ORD down at open

image.altText: A police badge.

props.synopsis: A Queensland man has been charged with sharing violent extremist material online after a raid by multiple law enforcement agencies.

title.children: Gold Coast man charged with sharing violent extremist material from terror organisation

image.altText: A close-up of a hand holding a paintbrush and painting a black circle on a red canvas, with paint pots nearby.

props.synopsis: The truth behind claims of "white hands on black art" will be tested in the SA Supreme Court as one of the country's best-known Aboriginal art groups sues Rupert Murdoch's national masthead for defamation.

title.children: The Australian newspaper sued over 'white hands on black art' reporting

image.altText: A man's hand holds large blueberries.

props.synopsis: New rules around a popular insecticide could lead to lower blueberry production, but growers are confident the industry will adapt.

title.children: Insecticide suspension could have 'massive impact' on blueberry crops

image.altText: A man wearing dark sunglasses and a black jacket

props.synopsis: Around 60 men attended a protest at NSW parliament organised by the Neo-Nazi group National Socialist Network on Saturday. Without masks, it gave the ABC the opportunity to identify some of them.

title.children: Civil engineer identified among those who attended Neo-Nazi protest

image.altText: Two bright orange fountains of lava spray with a group of people in silhouette at the bottom of the frame.

props.synopsis: David Finlay has captured images of bioluminescence, fireflies, ghost mushrooms, meteors and the aurora australis, but seeing one of the world's most active volcanoes spraying lava 450 metres in the air "takes the cake".

title.children: Hawaii's Kilauea volcano the 'best natural show on the planet'

image.altText: A man in khaki shorts and a hat stands on rocks overlooking a rugged tree-lined gorge.

props.synopsis: A WA pastoralist says he will not stand in the way of the bullets aimed at the donkeys on his remote property, but he will not kill the animals he claims have had a positive environmental impact.

title.children: Grazier accepts donkey cull order but refuses to pull the trigger himself

image.altText: A Rex Airlines flight lands in an airport.

props.synopsis: Regional councils say they want security bonds on airline carriers who use their airports to ensure stability for travellers.

title.children: Councils at the end of their tether with continued airline failures

image.altText: CCTV footage of a retail assault

props.synopsis: New offences for people assaulting or threatening service workers are expected to be introduced in time for the Christmas shopping rush.

title.children: Retail and hospitality workers to be protected under new Victorian laws

image.altText: A man leans over gym equipment towards the camera.

props.synopsis: A researcher who found "dangerous" toxic metals in illegal anabolic steroids is in talks the health department officials to continue his work despite Queensland's drug checking ban.

title.children: Government to have talks with illegal steroid researcher amid drug testing ban

image.altText: Two women cutting a cake side by side.

props.synopsis: As Kununurra battles with a surge in youth crime, residents in Fitzroy Crossing are celebrating their success in reducing rates through a community-led initiative.

title.children: As youth crime dominates headlines, this community has a solution
